svg.text: Many idioms in Chinese contain two numbers. These numbers are almost never literal in
(strange in all sorts of ways) and
emphasize a large quantity, as in
In many idioms that contain numbers, the two numbers are consecutive.
appear together, and imply that something is straightforward or clear-cut, as in
suggest messiness and chaos, as in
Some idioms involve non-consecutive numbers, such as
(all manner of, every kind of). There are also idioms in which
the numbers go from large to small, as in
Ke Lin just posted a review on TripAdvisor
What tips does he offer other tourists?
坐火車到雲南以後，我和
朋友們嚐了嚐地道的特色
小吃，還遊覽了像樹林一
樣的石林、古老的大理三
我們的導遊雖然很幽默，
但是一直讓我們買紀念
坐火车到云南以后 ，我和
朋友们尝了尝地道的特色
小吃 ，还游览了像树林一
样的石林 、古老的大理三
我们的导游虽然很幽默 ，
但是一直让我们买纪念
